description.narrative: (i) Continuing to strengthen the Philippine banking sector by providing long term capital, following IFC and IFC Cap Fund''s investment in BDO Unibank, Inc. in 2010 and RCBC in 2011, particularly in light of the higher capital requirements of Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas; (ii) Increasing access to finance to underserved segments in the Philippines such as SMEs, microenterprises, and homebuyers and women entrepreneurs, including in frontier regions outside Metro Manila; (iii) Promoting and expanding better corporate governance and risk management practices in the Philippine banking sector; and (iv) Contributing to the strengthening of environmental and social management practices in the country''s banking system.

This project comprises an investment in Rizal Commercial Banking Corporation (RCBC or the Bank), a bank in the Philippines, into which IFC, through the IFC Capitalization (Equity) Fund, LP is proposing an equity investment of up to US$100 million in the form of common shares. RCBC provides a wide range of banking and other financial products and services, including commercial and retail banking, credit cards, asset management and treasury. IFCs proposed investment will strengthen the Banks capital in anticipation of higher regulatory capital requirements of the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) and support the Banks growth. This project fits in with IFCs strategy to support the Philippine financial markets through equity type investments in local financial institutions that play a key role in providing access to finance to underserved sectors such as SMEs and housing.
